javadoc: An implementation of SaveState that exists primarily to signal its intended usage. The SaveState is a generic object for saving program state through plugins. This state object is meant to be used for preferences that are not associated directly with a plugin.

methods.javadoc:
Initializes a new state object from the given element.
@param element The element from which to initialize.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Initializes a new state object from the given element.

params.name: element
params.comment: The element from which to initialize.

name: PreferenceState
comment:
An implementation of SaveState that exists primarily to signal its intended usage.  The 
 SaveState is a generic object for saving program state through plugins.  This state object
 is meant to be used for preferences that are not associated directly with a plugin.
